abstract: Ruth Madoff said in an interview with The New York Times that she and Bernard Madoff attempted suicide two weeks after the Ponzi scheme was exposed in 2008.
snippet: Ruth Madoff said in an interview with The New York Times that she and Bernard Madoff attempted suicide two weeks after the Ponzi scheme was exposed in 2008.
lead_paragraph: On Christmas Eve 2008, two weeks after Bernard L. Madoff confessed to running history's largest Ponzi scheme, he and his wife, Ruth, attempted suicide in their Manhattan penthouse. The situation was "just horrific," Mrs. Madoff said in an interview with Diana B. Henriques of The New York Times. "And I thought, 'I just can't, I can't take this. I don't know how I'll ever get through this, nor do I want to.' So we decided to do it." Read more »

headline.main: Madoffs Tried to Commit Suicide, Wife Says
